intro: Dillwynia glaberrima var. longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed dillwynia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. It is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters, with its long, slender stems and clustered inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
